Identification of missio n-critical function s b. Identification of Critical Components (CCs) that can lead to Level 1 and Level 2 missio n-critical failures. c. The CFA shall assess CCs for applicable war fighting functions such as fires, C2 . d. The CFA shall assess both Organic and Inherited CCs . e. The CFA shall include risk evaluations and prioritization based on Supply Chain Risk management (SCRM ) f. The CFA shall identify mitigations to risk of foreign intelligence, technology exploitation, threats to supply chain, and battlefield threats and vulnerabilities. TITLE OF DATA ITEM Program Protection Implement Plan (PPIP ) 64. SUBTITL E 4. AUTHORIT Y (Data Acquisition Document No. ) DI-ADM N-81036/ T 5. CONTRACT REFERENCE SOO 6.12. 8 6. REQUIRING OFFIC E SFAE-CCC -MC 7. DD 250 REQ LT 9. DIST STATEMEN T REQUIRE D 10. FREQUENC Y See BLK 1 6 12.DATE OF FIRST SUBMISSIO N See BLK 1 6 14. DISTRIBUTIO N 8. APP COD E A D 11. AS OF DAT E See BLK 1 6 13. DATE OF SUBSEQUENT SUBMISSIO N See BLK 1 6 b. COPIE S 16. REMARK S Block 4: Prepare the required document, in contractor format, in accordance with the cited DID, and the provisions identified in the DoD 5200.1M, DoDI 5200.39 and Army Pamphlet 7 0-3.: a. ADDRESSE E DRAF T FINA L Reg Repr o The PPIP shall also address the reduction

of foreign intelligence, technology exploitation, supply chain and battlefield threats and system vulnerabilities that result in level 1 (total compromise of mission capability/death/loss of system) and level 2 (unacceptable compromise of mission capability/injury/property damage/system damage/ mission termination or degradation) including: 1. The application of supply chain risk management best practices, applied as appropriate to the development of the system. S upply Chain Risk Management key practices may be found in the NIST Interagency Report 7622, Piloting Supply Chain Risk Management for Federal Information Systems, and the National Defense Industrial Association Guidebook, Engineering for System Assurance, both publicly available. 2. The enumeration of potential suppliers of logi c-bearing components that implement, or introduce vulnerability of functions that may result in a level 1 or 2 protection failure. The enumeration of potential suppliers shall incl ude cost, schedule and performance information relevant for choice among alternates and planned selection for the purpose of engaging with the government to develop mutuall y-agreeable risk management plans for the suppliers to be solicited. 3. The process es to control access by foreign nationals to program information, including, but not limited to, system design information, Do D-unique technology, and software or hardware used to integrate commercial technology . 4. The processes and practices employed to e nsure that genuine information and communications technology (ICT) will be employed in the solution and that processes and requirements for genuine ICT are levied upon subcontractors . 5. The processes used to protect unclassified DoD information in the de velopment environment . 6. The processes and practices used to ensure the security of software and softwar e- based applications, including use of foreign developed or controlled software, to include the purchase of U.S .-owned companies (who provide software a nd/or hardware to the acquisition development effort) by foreig n-owned companies . REQUIRING OFFIC E SFAE-CCC -MC 7. DD 250 REQ LT 9. DIST STATEMEN T REQUIRE D 10. FREQUENC Y See BLK 1 6 12.DATE OF FIRST SUBMISSIO N See BLK 1 6 14. DISTRIBUTIO N 8. APP COD E A D 11. REMARK S Block 4: Prepare the required document, in contractor format, in accordance with the cited DID, and the following : a. ADDRESSE E DRAF T FINA L Reg Repr o a. Preliminary Hazard List, Preliminary Hazard Analysis, System Requirements Hazard Analysis, Subsystem Hazard Analysis, System Hazard Analysis, Functional Hazard Analysis, Syste m-Of-Systems Hazard Analysis and, Safety design approval documents. b. In addition , the SAR shall contain an appendices with the Safety Significant Software Functions (SSSFs). The following Tasks of MI L-STD-882E are applicable: TASK 101, 102, 106, 201 -203, 205, 208, 209, 301. c. The SAR shall include a matrix that traces each safety requi rement to its respective test case. The matrix shall specify for each safety requirement the unique requirement ID, the requirement mnemonic, test case ID, and test procedure ID. Safety Test procedures will be submitted upon request . d. Analytical technique s to be used in the analysis performance are: Software fault tree analysis and Petri net analysis . e. The Contractor shall include in the SAR a metrics data on the testing of safety requirements. This data shall include total number of safety requirements versus number of safety requirements tested versus number of safety requirements tested successfully . Block 9: Distribution D: Distribution authorized to the Department of Defense and U.S. DoD contractors only; further distribution at the direction of P roject Manager, Mission Command, SFA E-CCC-MC . Block 10, 11, 12 & 13: The Contractor shall deliver a draft SAR 30 calendar days prior to Preliminary Design Review (PDR). Subsequent submission shall be made in conjunction with Critical Design Review (CDR ) and each capability drop that alters the safety assessment. Subsequent submission shall be made 15 business days after completion of Test for Record (TFR). The Government shall review and provide comments within 30 calendar days of receipt of the doc ument. The final reproduced version is due back to the Government within 30 calendar days following the receipt of comments.
